Posts.EditableText: I would like to make a kind of easter egg cheat in my game(s), and I was hoping to use the famous "xyzzy" command. Unfortunately, the stupid Quest program already has that command in the database. As far as I can tell, there's no way to access it. I'm sure there is, of course, and I must have missed something. Please help!
Posts.HTML: I would like to make a kind of easter egg cheat in my game(s), and I was hoping to use the famous "xyzzy" command. Unfortunately, the stupid Quest program already has that command in the database. As far as I can tell, there's no way to access it. I'm sure there is, of course, and I must have missed something. Please help!

Posts.EditableText: Oh, right, and also, I am currently using the online version of Quest. If that makes a difference.
Posts.HTML: Oh, right, and also, I am currently using the online version of Quest. If that makes a difference.

Posts.EditableText: Just create a new command, and put `xyzzy` in as the pattern to match (just the same as if there was no built in "xyzzy" command in fact).
Posts.HTML: Just create a new command, and put xyzzy in as the pattern to match (just the same as if there was no built in "xyzzy" command in fact).
